author: Accuweather
title: NY WFO BINGHAMTON Warnings, Watches, and Advisories
text:
WFO BINGHAMTON Warnings, Watches and Advisories for Saturday, March 23, 2024
WINTER STORM WARNING
URGENT - WINTER WEATHER MESSAGE
National Weather Service Binghamton NY
950 AM EDT Fri Mar 22 2024
...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS
AFTERNOON TO 2 PM EDT SATURDAY...
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9
inches.
* WHERE...Northern Oneida county.
* WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 2 PM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
People are also readingâ€¦
conditions could impact the evening commute.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will begin to develop this
afternoon, and may be heavy at times tonight into Saturday
morning. Snow may briefly mix with sleet or freezing rain
Saturday morning.
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.
The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet
accumulations of 2 to 4 inches.
* WHERE...Onondaga county.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will move into the area early this
evening, before mixing with sleet and rain overnight and early
Saturday morning. Precipitation likely changes back to snow by
mid-Saturday morning.
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations
of 2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an
inch.
* WHERE...Madison and Southern Oneida counties.
evening, before mixing with sleet, freezing rain, and rain
overnight and early Saturday morning. Precipitation likely
changes back to snow by late Saturday morning.
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS
EVENING TO 2 PM EDT SATURDAY...
of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an
* WHERE...Otsego, Delaware and Sullivan counties.
* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 2 PM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing
rain will develop this evening, before changing to mainly rain
Saturday morning. Freezing rain will hold on the longest at
elevations greater than 2000 feet. The greatest snow and ice
accumulations will be across northern portions of Otsego
county.
